channel.title: Thank God For Chest Armour
channel.description:
Well, yesterday was my first ride back. I forgot to take some pictures :( Anyway. I can;'t believe it, my luck just sucks. I had never riden this track before.... It was on a friends farm.. And, about 40 minutes before we left, I was doing the double I was doing all day... Except, I accidentally landed with my foot on the back break pedal. I didn' even know my back wheel was locked and no spinning, until my bike stalled in the air. The bike landed and slid with me on it, just skidding straightways, into a small double that you would role over. (They're about 5 metres apart) and I went off the take off, still skidding, and I landed PLUNK straight on the landing ramp, front-wheel first. My chest hit the handlebars, knocking them fully forward, and really winding me. My head got jerked forward, although thanks to a neck roll, I didn't get whiplash :P I fell back straight onto my back and tumbled backwards. My best friend Jake who was watching me after his bike went into a ditch (He landed wrong and went off the track, he bailed though :P) And his big brother who was riding a 250F (Four-stroke) helped the bike off of me, and got me off the track. I was able to walk away, though if I wasn't wear chest armour, I would be in Hospital with broken ribs for sure. Also, a neck brace on probly from how hard my head would have hit my chest.
The point of this story.....
Always wear your gear when riding a pushbike/motorbike, whether it be wear skying, always take precautions.

item.title: Thank God For Chest Armour
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Yes, I’m 12, and you need a license to ride them on the road, only bikes that are road made though, example the Wr250F (That’s the Yamaha Race bike especially designed for the road) You need to go through three stages, example i a car, it’s L’s/P’s/Full License. Same as on a motorbike, instead of passengers in a car, it’s doubling on the bike.

Read full topic

item.title: Thank God For Chest Armour
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Gotta Catch Them All:

What so you can race with it but you can’t ride it on like roads?

You are only permitted to ride them at tracks or designated bush areas. Never roads.

Thanks
~io9[/quote]

item.title: Thank God For Chest Armour
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“slayer215, post:4, topic:39145”]450 lol

I stopped riding when I was like 11. Although I remember having to wear elbow pads, knee pads, a helmet, chest protector, alpine boots, a jersey, some good pants, and some of my dad’s goggles when I went to ride. When I screwed up, I didn’t feel shit.[/quote]
I see people riding wit no gear on, and think “You wait buddy” And they’re the people who end up dead.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

slayer215:

Yeah I know, those things are life savers. You could land on a damn rock at 40 mph wearing a goodn and wouldn’t get hurt

Yeah. I was following behind Jake’s brother who was on a four-fifty… Imaging how hard the rocks of the back wheel hit you of one of them suckers…

@Yz85Racer wrote:
